website_summaries.verdict: Constructed with a number of helpful accessories, this impressive chalk bag is as efficient as it is affordable.
pros: The bag's versatile construction makes it suitable for rock climbers, gymnasts, and weight lifters
Customers rave over the bag's perfect size and easy accessibility
cons: Some users had trouble opening and closing the drawstring after a few months

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a buddy and I, they're fantasic bags. The bag is a good size and fits a lot in its side pocket. The drawstring tightens down well and minimal chalk will come out when closed.
customer_reviews.author: Itzak210

customer_reviews.title: Chalk bags used for camera lenses. Fastener pops off on ONLY THIS BRAND bag.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice quality bag, HOWEVER, it is the only chalk bag that loses the fastener connection right away. I purchased two defferent times and it happened again. I have collected several chalk bags in over 10 years and this problem never occurs on over 7 other brand names.Other than that, it is a very well made bag.
customer_reviews.author: Easadude

customer_reviews.title: Holds my phone :)
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it has 2 pockets. One pocket is big enough to fit your phone in, the other pocket is a little tighter and smaller. I really liked that I could have my phone handy to take pictures while I was climbing. The bag comes with an adjustable strap. You can expand it and clip it around your waist or you can tighten the straps and put it on your harness. Bag tightens quite well if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: been using it for a year now and it's great and very handy buying a 2nd paid because I lost my 1st
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Gaber

customer_reviews.title: Useless after four or times days of use.
customer_reviews.text: After about four times using it, the friction on the drawstring had increased so much that to make the opening, I had to wiggle the drawstring and opening with two hands. Takes forever now. By the fifth day of use, the large zipper (meant for cell phones) got jammed, so much so that the zipper handle broke off! I only used it three or four times. I'm going to be looking for a better brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Unique Individual

customer_reviews.title: Chalk it up to being cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This bag isn't even OK. The opening to the bag is extremely difficult to, well, open. The string is seemingly stuck most of the time. If I weren't a rock climber, I wouldn't have the grip strength necessary to open it most of the time. I guess it's a good warm up. The metal ring which is meant to guide the pull string fell out almost instantly. The bag leaks chalk through the seems. So anything you put into the pockets attached to it gets really chalky.
customer_reviews.author: unimaginabletoast

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy about this. Awesome bag. Love the pockets. It just only fits older phones. Not my iPhone 7s+. But still no complaints. Love it! Would definitely buy again if need!!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Great value, and closes securely to keep the chalk in.
customer_reviews.text: I have wide hands and this bag is wide and deep enough to accommodate them. It seems pretty durable and the closure works well to keep the chalk in. The only negative is that it's a bit tall and doesn't stand up, so probably better suited for sport climbers instead of boulders. Also, it's too popular and so many people have this exact same bag at the bouldering gym so it's easy to grab the wrong one. I don't use the zippered pockets, but my phone fits (OnePlus 5T, 6" display).
customer_reviews.author: kylenetkyle

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for my hands and phone
customer_reviews.text: I climb indoor and outdoor and this chalk bag goes with me everywhere I go. I'm 6'4 and you know what they say about tall guys, they have big hands. A lot of chalk bags are too small but this one is perfect and allows me to easily access the chalk without fumbling around while I climb. The fact that it has a pocket for your phone or wallet is an extra bonus. I no longer have to worry about leaving my phone or wallet on the floor or not being able to stretch my legs and have my phone get in the way. I like the size and durability of this big. I would totally recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Solid chalk bag for the price. I love that I can put my iPhone 6+ in it. My only complaint is that it isn't stiff enough to stand up on its own. It falls over a lot and sometimes get chalk on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dropping

customer_reviews.title: Great chalk bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great; I put a ball of chalk inside of it and use it for indoor/outdoor top rope and bouldering. White chalk is obviously going to make the bag look powdery, but it is the signal of good use! There are several pockets that I enjoy. One for my phone or credit card - things I do not want to be stolen while I am not paying attention. Holds my chap-stick and a pony tail holder! Easy to adjust, and cute!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying an iPhone 8+ and car keys
customer_reviews.text: I own a few chalk bags but I wanted something I could use at the gym and keep my phone with me rather than trusting the communal cubby holes. The vertical pocket in this is plenty big to fit the iPhone 8+ with case and the horizontal pocket I use for my car key. Beyond that it's $12 and holds chalk so my only major complaint is that I wish there were more color options!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hengst

customer_reviews.title: Great chalk bag!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a climber, but I needed something to keep my chalk in at the gym. It's kind of an unwritten "rule" that they don't want chalk messes, however, I NEED chalk when lifting. This bag allows me to use my chalk and put my hands in the bag and diminishes the amount of excess chalk in the air and on the ground. I just clip it to the small bag I use when training.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Meriwether

customer_reviews.title: I tend to lose things before they deteriorate so its perfect for
customer_reviews.text: I mean id give it 5 stars for price but this is not some $50 REI chalk bag the cleips and product are made of lesser quality, but if you're looking for a chalk bag that will last 10 years this is the one. I tend to lose things before they deteriorate so its perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: jmel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the climbing gym!
customer_reviews.text: One word: Functional If this chalk bag had to be summed up in one word, re-read my first line. That aside..... it’s not trendy, it’s not “namebrand”, and you probably won’t have anyone asking you where you got it from. However, this bag holds chalk just like any other bag that costs 3x as much AND it will also hold your cellphone, car keys, wallet, or whatever else you may want/need to keep on your person while you are at the climbing gym. I don’t know about you, but I usually try to avoid keep my personal effects in cheap gym lockers. This bag lets me avoid that all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dog Training
customer_reviews.text: Rather thank climbing, I purchased this for dog training. The bag holds my Iphone XS Max in the back pocket, and my ID in the front one. I can put enough training treats in it to last several sessions. I am able to put the treats in separate ziplock bags and still be able to reach in for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Chick

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The inside of the pouch has a minky lining that won't play nice with loose chalk. I use a chalk sock and it isn't a problem. Other than that, the quality seems to be about the same as bags which are twice the price. I can fit my phone (Galaxy S10e) plus thick case into the side pocket. It's easy to reach when hanging from my harness when I am rope climbing and can be puffed up to stand up on it's own when I am bouldering. Overall, pleased with the purchase. My drawstring came broken and feels flimsy, so the product loses a star. The ends of the drawstring can be heated to prevent them from fraying.
customer_reviews.author: some_guy

customer_reviews.title: Does it hold your chalk? Yes.  Can it bring your descent to a halt; momentarily.
customer_reviews.text: So it's a bag that holds chalk and other size appropriate items which it is good at . I don't use the belt so don't ask me how well that performs. My only complaint with this item would be the drawstring. Twice I had this wrap around the climbing rope and become an issue where it temporarily brought my descent to a halt. There might have been a third time had the spring-loaded piece not exploded from the combination of being tightly wound around the climbing rope and my belayer attempting to lower me. Could this have been something I did? Certainly, fool me once shame on you, fool me twice... you get the point.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price and features
customer_reviews.text: One of the few kings with a practical phone pouch. It also has a separate card pouch. These features work well. The material is somewhat of a lesser quality than a $20 bag, thinner and the strap clip closure is as strong/tight. Since I go to the gym mostly and ain’t climbing that much, it works just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: HomeMaker

customer_reviews.title: Great slingshot ammo bag!
customer_reviews.text: Well made little bag I will be using for slingshot ammo. All seams well sewn it seems (whut?) and the zipper appears to be high quality. Plenty of room for my Hathcock target sniper and more ammo then I'd want to be carrying around!
customer_reviews.author: Windchime

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after one use !!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it one time and it is already falling apart. The stitching from the beginning was not well , there were loose end all over the place but I didn't think much of it as long as it worked. What really did it is the crimped metal piece that helps in keeping the bag closed just fell off. As well the plastic piece that holds the strings at the end just snapped off. Tremendously disappointed in the quality of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters
customer_reviews.text: As a climbing noob, this bag fulfills all of my needs quite easily. Favourite part is definitely the wide neck — as a big-handed person, it’s soooo nice to not have to scrunch up my fingers super tightly to chalk up. It’s the little things, you know? Other than that it again seems more then satisfactory — good inside texture, light, holds a great amount of chalk, and the pockets are neat! I’m mainly climbing in a small gym where I can keep my stuff in a cubby, but it’s nice to know that if I climb outside/in a new place, I’ll be able to keep my things close at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Chloë Ester K. Cook

customer_reviews.title: It's a chalk bag. It has handy pockets. ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a chalk bag. It has handy pockets. Really, what more do you want?
customer_reviews.author: Twisty Tie

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and cool looking bag
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product. It has plenty of po kets to hold my phone and keys. It looks like a really well-made bag that will last a long time. Perfect size and looks really cool. My large hands fit perfectly and don’t get stuck. **If my review was helpful to you, please click the “Helpful” button below, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: Fits Note 8 with case but gets a little snug.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome chalk bag. Fits a Samsung Note 8 with a slim case perfectly. The only drawback is that I use a chalk sock, and with the phone in the large pocket, it's a little snug when reaching in to get some chalk. Not a huge issue but a little more space would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: This bag is being used in a gym, not rock wall
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than chalk in a zip lock bag. so much better in helping keep the gym clean and no way this is going to develop little tears like a plastic bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed with this product. The metal part of the drawstring from inside the bag came out and the strings came out of the plastic end. It's very difficult to open. Unfortunately the return window closed in 30 days which I feel is indicative of the time they feel this product should last.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag, but drawstring wore out in about a year
customer_reviews.text: A solid bag overall, I like the size and placement of pockets and the bag feels bigger than it is (if that makes sense). Only reason I'm replacing it is that the drawstring wore out after about 13 months of pretty regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mullin

customer_reviews.title: Great Chalk Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boyfriend because he was always using my chalk bag ... I actually like his better now! It's a great size, nice and large for ample chalk, and the best feature is the phone pocket! plenty of room for phone and keys. I recommend! The material is great too, doesn't leave a chalky film like my Prana one.
customer_reviews.author: TheBigOak

customer_reviews.title: Good chalk bag with plenty of extra pockets (by plenty I mean two)
customer_reviews.text: This chalk bag is a great bag that comes with chalk. It has two zip pockets, one fits my VW key easily, the other fits my iPhone 7+ sorta easily (well you work it in a bit but it does fit!) then it has a large pocket with a bag of chalk in it... so yeah, it works great for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Alright for the price
customer_reviews.text: What you would expect from a chalk back, unfortunately my cinch string broke when I was tightening the bag. I just tied it around the bag to close it. I'm sure if I would have contacted the company to replace it, they would have but I never got around to it and now I'm waiting for the season to come back around.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J Drake

customer_reviews.title: good bag!
customer_reviews.text: i like the bag. does its job but the strap is soooo long why does it need to be so long. i think i won't use it and just find something else to hook it to my harness with. i love the pockets , one for phone one for cards or cash.
customer_reviews.author: Shiny Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Review after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for about a year. Then, it started becoming more and more difficult to open the bag. It's like the strap started to get caught on something.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love the soft fleece inside, it helps get the excess chalk off of my hands before removing them from the bag. It is smaller than a lot of other bags and simple. Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Kelley

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: works. Only thing i dislike about it is the opening is small. Currently looking for other designs. Bought this one bc it had zipper pockets for my phone
customer_reviews.author: phi

customer_reviews.title: Side pocket
customer_reviews.text: I started indoor rock climbing a few months ago and have seen this bag about 20 times. I have bonded with people over it because it is great. I like the side pocket a lot, it allows me to have my phone on me while climbing if I need to check it during my breaks. I also have my tape in the pocket for when I get cut up. It is very light and holds a good amount of chalk.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Smith-Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit
customer_reviews.text: It's a good bag, but the downside is when you put your phone in it, your hand no longer fits. It competes for space with the chalk. Do NOT buy this if you plan to have your phone in there. It just stops being functional.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Handy pouch for a stagehand.
customer_reviews.text: Great little bag to hang from my belt while working. It holds glovess, a flashlight, gum, eye drops... My phone fits perfectly in the side zipper pouch and the front zipper is perfect for ID... 4 stars is because the belt loops broke the first day and I had to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D.

customer_reviews.title: Hardware is too lightweight to be trusted
customer_reviews.text: Clip broke on belt/sling first day climbing indoors. The bag holds plenty of chalk and is easy enough to get a larger hand in but if the bag will not stay attached to you while climbing then what's the point. I can replace the buckle but will not give a higher review because the product should last over an hour of easy wear and tear climbing. I will spend more next time in Hope's of getting a little more quality and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: christian yeager

customer_reviews.title: Not very well built
customer_reviews.text: Great little bag but the first time I pulled the string to close the bag it broke off from the plastic keeper.
customer_reviews.author: jeff shipley

customer_reviews.title: A chalk back that works for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Bag works. Strap has plastic clip that seems sturdy enough while still being break away. Pocket will indeed hold an Iphone in an otterbox. Closure also tightens completely, and lip of bag is stiff enough to hold it's shape after being rolled around and squeezed. Overall, seems great quality an no issues yet (no stitching or material defects). Will update if anything comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Brant Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!  Just make sure you put a sticker on it
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed a lot of people at my local climbing gym have this pack as well, and for good reason! It is a great value and gets the job done. great for holding things like your cellphone and earbuds or even wallet. Just make sure you put a sticker on it so you can tell yours apart from the rest of them! i.e. the other people in the gym with the same bag ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag
customer_reviews.text: Great chalk bag for lifting! I use this for my gym bag to hold my chalk since there is no chalk bowl at my gym. Keeps the chalk contained which is great, since I am not really looking for chalk dust on all my gear. The zipper pockets seem like a cool feature, I don't actually use them, but it seems cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mauk

customer_reviews.title: Great bag but not for people with bigger hands.
customer_reviews.text: I do love the feel of this bag, its strong, fits well, light, and holds your phone pretty well..... But the hand hole is very very small. If you are a smaller person this will be great for you but, anyone with bigger hands this will not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Wood

customer_reviews.title: Handy Pockets But Drawstring Closure Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this bag since it had pockets for my keys and phone, BUT it broke after 2 months of use! The fabric inside that holds the drawstring is nylon, and after closing and opening the bag for a few trips, it started to rip. Now it won't close at all. Still planning to use it since the bag itself isn't leaking, but now I have to be extra careful when storing it. No one wants a surprise chalk explosion!
customer_reviews.author: loremipsum

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Having a new puppy its important to carry a lot of dog treats. My wife bought the worlds smallest treat bag marketed for dogs so i stepped it up and got his one. Great size and quality and does everything we wanted it to do. Would highly recommend for this usage.
customer_reviews.author: Gross Family

customer_reviews.title: good chalk bag!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few months now. Works just fine. I do like to tuck the bungee pull cord into the zipper pocket, otherwise it tends to end up in the chalk and I've gotten my hand tangled in the cord. lol. No downsides to it that I've noticed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scholle

customer_reviews.title: Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Literally tried to close it one time after it was delivered and the drawstring immediately broke. Now I can't even close it! All the features of this bag would be great if the components weren't so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bag Doesn't Close Completely -- Chalk Dust Constantly Puffs Out
customer_reviews.text: Everything is wonderful about this bag except that the draw string doesn't close completely. Chalk constantly puffs out of the bag as a result. I ended up putting my chalk in a plastic bag and then inside the Sukoa. Seems redundant to use two bags but that's what's necessary to keep the chalk IN the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: The zippered pockets are fantastic, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, Son loves it. Bought it for the zippered pockets to hold his phone and keys. Great size and easily the quality of the more expensive brands, but has more features. PERFECT for someone starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Denton Lesslie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for my granddaughter. My granddaughter is very petite, so my only negative on this bag is the belt is to loose for her. She is able to still used and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: diane1115

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, world like a charm. Love that it has a clip on the strap, it makes it easy for my kiddos to take it outside and use for the monkey bars.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: For 1 block of chalk. Holds chalk well, drawstring does the job. Opening is not large enough for adult average size male but perfect for women and older teens.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Makeup Artist4Life

customer_reviews.title: just annoying. iphone 6 fits nicely in the large zipper ...
customer_reviews.text: works as intended, but about 2 minutes into using it the metal ring for the draw string fell out. not critical, just annoying. iphone 6 fits nicely in the large zipper pocket. Great for holding things you don't want to leave in the car, locker, or fall out of your pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Jagger

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Has served me well in a couple bouldering experiences. Would recommend to new climbers as it’s so affordable and the zippers are great. Keeps chalk from falling out
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Large, functional chalk bag
customer_reviews.text: Great chalk bag. Is large, can fit my Phone in the side pocket, and has an additional pocket for other items too.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great value, functional and great for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: great size, zipper pocket capable of fitting very large smartphones (mine galaxy s10 plus i think is the name?), sturdy, puch sinch works well, great price Con's: not the biggest fan of the waist band and clip. Would have prefered if it was a double loop system and not a plastic clip. Also the loops to connect the chalk bag to your harness dont seem very stury. Time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Lyell

customer_reviews.title: arrived quickly & as expected. would buy from them ...
customer_reviews.text: arrived quickly & as expected. would buy from them again. i actually use the pouch to carry my golf balls, tees, ball repair tool, etc. have it clipped near the carry handle of my walking bag.
customer_reviews.author: jrw

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for your iPhone XS!
customer_reviews.text: * The big pocket on this chalk bag is big enough for my iPhone XS. This is not true of the Black Diamond Mojo Large Chalk Bag pocket. * The second (smaller) is great as well - roughly the size of a credit card. I keep fingernail clippers in there. * Customer service fantastic. After 2 years of use, chalk got into the closure mechanism so it kept catching/sticking when I tried to open or shut the drawstring. I contacted Shinzaro and they replaced it right away. Amazing service!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Chang

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, save your money.
customer_reviews.text: The draw string broke the first time I pulled on it to retract so chalk bag sphincter. Only seconds out of the packaging and already showing poor quality. The side pocket is good sized though, and can hold most large phones.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: I use this in production and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: I clip this bag onto my belt loop with a carabiner and use it like an extra pocket when I am on showsite. The front zippered pocket really comfortably fits like 4 compact tampons! there's a little elastic loop that is perfect for sticking pens, and i have an iphone xs with a super bulky pelican case that still fits in the large zippered pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Teh

customer_reviews.title: Solid Build the hip strap isn't too bad at all
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid set up to have and to be honest, it's a great opportunity to use this chalk back not only for chalk but also for tools.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Stahelin

customer_reviews.title: Get it.  For sure.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag with well designed, convenient pockets large enough for keys in one and cell phone in the other. I keep my cell phone in the exterior side pouch it has which allows me to wear an LG Tone Bluetooth headset, synced to my cell phone close by.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me, but saved my review because of good service.
customer_reviews.text: Don't use for carrying tools. Broke on me, but the company reached out with great customer service. They refunded my order completely after my initial, more negative review. I imagine this bag would be fine for use with only actual chalk.
customer_reviews.author: Ian S

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! Love the large and small pocket. Lot of room for chalk.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nasca

customer_reviews.title: So it's pretty much useless since all my chalk will fall out ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine was defective. The cord you pull to close it up doesn't work. So it's pretty much useless since all my chalk will fall out unless I keep it upright.
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great chalk bag! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first chalk bag. It is amazing, and works as intended. I've never used the zipper pocket on it. I expect this chalk bag to last for years. It feels durable.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy it. Just Don’t turn upside down. Chalk will come out. Doesn't close like a ziplock bag.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Very good, versatile bag
customer_reviews.text: You can put in loose chalk or a chalk bag inside. Pocket is big enough for the mobile and/or cards/keys. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Maliha Sultana

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey but good. Could have a better attachment
customer_reviews.author: jerry goff

customer_reviews.title: Good solid chalk bag
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this chalk bag for a few months now and have been very pleased. The zipper pocket is convenient to keep my keys. The buckle is sturdy and reliable. The thing that was most important to me is that when I pull the string tight, the bag seals off really well and chalk doesn't spill out.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The belt snap broke the second time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory
customer_reviews.text: Great gym accessory. Easy to use and carry around. The only problem is that the plastic clip that keeps it closed breaks easily.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Soto

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Good bag I fell on mine and the string adjuster broke but besides that it works great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Keaton

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for beginner
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any problems with it yet! Works well, came as described
customer_reviews.author: James Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: what can I say -- it holds my chalk. I have some weight stuff in my basement, and occasional requires a little chalk. This keeps it up off the floor and doesn't make much of a mess.
customer_reviews.author: B. Florence

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, great price
customer_reviews.text: Well made with a super soft fleece inner pouch. My son and I have been climbing with these bags twice a week for three months and they still look new. The zipper side pouch is small, but will carry your license and a couple of other cards as well. If something happens to one of our bags, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JSimp

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bouldering
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a couple weeks now. Overall, a great product. The cinch works well and the inside of the bag feels soft. The one critique is it's a tight fit for my phone (Samsung Galaxy) and can't fit much more. If you bring wallet/phone/keys to the gym, you'll have a tight fit. Other than that, it's holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Doggie Bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a doggie treat bag and it's wonderful :)
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wei

customer_reviews.title: For the price I can't complain too much.. ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price I can't complain too much... but my orange drawstring cord broke after two days of use. Other than that, the zipper pocket is big enough to fit my pixel 2 XL even with a case on.
customer_reviews.author: Chad S.

customer_reviews.title: Zippered pockets
customer_reviews.text: Is a little larger than my old bag, but holds my phone in a secure zippered pocket, for those photos at the top !
customer_reviews.author: AK. Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great budget bag
customer_reviews.text: For a budget bag this is great to start out with, it sinches tight and have two good size pockets on it. The hole for the hand is a little bit smaller than I would like but it's still a good bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Steinfeld

customer_reviews.title: Good Chalk Bag
customer_reviews.text: My son and I climb all the time and use this and one other chalk bag. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: diverdude

customer_reviews.title: Chalk bag
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a rock climber, but I do weight training. I have been using this to keep my chalk and it works great - no mess in my bag, easy to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Star

customer_reviews.title: No drawstring pinchy-thingy
customer_reviews.text: So when my bat-hook isn't available or efficient for climbing, I need something like this. Well, it would be a lot better if it actually came with the drawstring pinchy-thingy. So I'm going to have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Great little sack!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality bag. I use it on my tree climbing saddle to carry my phone and other things while aloft in the tree.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, competitive price.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, nice product- ring on zipper pull is a little too open and the pull fell off with the first use. Gave this to my stepson for Christmas- he says it's easy to access when he's climbing and is holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: JaraSaneRilian

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bag, hangs a bit too low when attached to harness.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first chalk bag. For bouldering it works great. For attaching to a harness for top roping though, the bag hangs too low. The zipper also becomes difficult to use when it gets chalky, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Nk343

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but holds the chalk.
customer_reviews.text: The eyelet that the string goes through came off of the bag within a couple weeks. The string does not open easily, so it's kind of difficult to get your hand in and out of the bag unless you just leave it open, but then you just get chalk E V E R Y W H E R E.
customer_reviews.author: n6lisa

customer_reviews.title: Slightly large but good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is slightly larger than I was expecting for a climbing chalk bag. Overall it works perfect and seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: On the whole it functions as expected. The one ...
customer_reviews.text: On the whole it functions as expected. The one unexpected flaw was that the little plastic piece fell off the end of the orange cords which means the other plastic piece which you use to close the bag can come off the cords if you dont pay attention when opening the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too big but not too small. Holds a ...
customer_reviews.text: Not too big but not too small. Holds a lot of chalk, it can also fit my iphone 7 and cards. The drawstring really holds the chalk inside. 10/10 would get this bag again if I ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The drawstring crapped out on me within a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Love the bag slot for my phone
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag slot for my phone. And I personally use the little zipper pouch for my protein bars. It's a good size, good quality material, and good color selection.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Wing

customer_reviews.title: Holds chalk like a pro
customer_reviews.text: Holds chalk like a pro. The side zipper for my phone (iPhone X) is so clutch too. It's a little tight if you have a plus model phone.
customer_reviews.author: soccerman19

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Doe's the job well, for me it's quite narrow because I got thick hands, for those who share the same attribute I recommend considering different one for lead climbing. If you're only bouldering that would do the job
customer_reviews.author: itay bp

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap chalk bags.
customer_reviews.text: So we got two of these bags. One of them works just fine. It's great to not have chalk coming out from that wool-like material that other bags have. It's also plenty deep, so you can fit two hands in there pretty easily. The little zippers that are built in are super convenient. One of the chalk bags actually started tearing at the pull strings, so that kind of sucks
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It looks good. But the second I touched the elastic part to the side of the bag it started to come undone. But you get what you pay for 🤷🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this bag about a month, using it 3-5x a week. It works great and the zip pockets are great for phones, rings, keys, license, etc. Only thing that’s a little annoying is the belt isn’t easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Sukoa Chalk Bag for Rock Climbing - Bouldering Chalk Bag Bucket with Quick-Clip Belt and 2 Large Zippered Pockets - Rock Climbing Gear Equipment
feature_bullets: Chalk Bag for Rock Climbing, Weightlifting, Bouldering, Gymnastics and Crossfit. Comes with easy to use quick clip belt or clip to harnesses and carabiners with ease thanks to the 2 loops on the back.

2 pocket climbing bag for storing large valuables. Store your ID, keys, cards & large phones easily. Convenient rock climbing gear equipment helps you to never miss an opportunity to capture those breath-taking moments.
Large main compartment for chalk bucket accommodates big hands. Spend more time manoeuvring through difficult spots, not struggling out of tiny chalk bag pockets.
Adjustable draw cord closes tight to prevent chalk spills. No more wasted weekends & money cleaning out the backseat.
Premium quality rock climbing chalk bag with water resistant material. Backed up with our chalk bags lifetime guarantee. Satisfaction or your money back. Order Now.
